dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAN ACROSS the frightened faces of NINE WITNESSES, eyes f straight ahead. A POLICE OFFICER walks slowly past each - FOOTSTEPS ECHOING in their fear.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: Take your time. Take a good look. He passes a nervous SAFEWAY CASHIER in uniform.

dialogues.speaker: SAFEWAY CASHIER
dialogues.text: Ah, a-are you sure they can't see us?

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: Two-way mirror, ma'am. He passes a UNIFORMED CHEERLEADER, an OLDER WOMAN, then a FACTORY WORKER, who removes his "Lincoln, Local 186" cap wipes his nervous brow.

dialogues.speaker: FACTORY WORKER
dialogues.text: But they're trained killers. A guy at the plant says, "In 'Nam they could smell ya!"

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: This is the United States of America, Sir. Officer reaches the end of the line - presses an intercom

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (into intercom) Face front. Witnesses react - GASP - avert their eyes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The source of their fear - FIVE UNIFORMED CHEERLEADERS against the suspect wall. They look like deer caught in  headlights. A sixth cheerleader, DIAN WESTON, is helped up the steps. One thing separates her from the rest - SHE'S SIX MONTHS PREGNANT.

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: (friendly, to female officer) I'm sorry to bother you, ma'am, but is this going to take long? It's game night.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: (on intercom) Picture in three -- Like saying "walk" to a dog, the girls instantly smile.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (on intercom) -- two, one...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLASH WHITE to INDIVIDUAL MUG SHOTS (with CREDITS) over LINCOLN HIGH SCHOOL SONG.

dialogues.speaker: MATCH DISSOLVE WHITE INTO
dialogues.text: A LIGHT hanging above a table.

dialogues.speaker: FBI AGENT, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: ...a heinous crime has been committed here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA TRACKS EYE LEVEL around the table where an FBI AGE (mid-40's, black suit), sits across from LISA JANUSCH (cheerleader from the witness side) - pretty, in a man-ma way - bitchy in a B-squad Cheerleader way. Other black suited AGENTS stand in the room. CHEERLEADER MUG SHOTS co the table.

dialogues.speaker: FBI AGENT
dialogues.text: ...and testifying in such a case is a serious matter. Should you decide your testimony would jeopardize your personal safety.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: Look, "Sipowitz", I said I'd tell you everything - I was just hoping to finish up before menopause kicks in. She smiles sweetly to the agent, then pushes Diane's MUG toward him.

dialogues.speaker: LISA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (dropping smile) Let's start with the one who thinks her shit don't stink. Diane Weston.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Foggy, heart-shaped mirror.

dialogues.speaker: LISA, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: She's like a goddamn poster child for high school. A HAND ENTERS FRAME and WIPES CLEAR the mirror, REVEALING DIANE (pregnant cheerleader in opening - not pregnant now

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: (to self in mirror) Morning, sunshine. Remember, these are the best days of your life. She starts to leave - then comes back.

dialogues.speaker: DIANE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: -- so far! She bucks her chin in the mirror and smiles - she's beyon adorable.

dialogues.speaker: LISA, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: If I wasn't such a lady, I'd tell you what a bitch she really is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sign reads "CHEERLEADING TRYOUTS." PAN DOWN a long line o HOPEFUL GIRLS.

dialogues.speaker: LISA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: She's the A-squad captain - stole the title from me. You should charge her with that...

dialogues.speaker: END ON
dialogues.text: Diane, pompoms on hips, smiles toward the camera. A SIGN the floor in front of her reads: "SQUAD MEMBER." A SIGN t her left reads: "CHALLENGER". BRUCE, an effeminate young man, bounds up behind the "CHALLENGER" sign - putting his pompoms on hips.

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: Hey, Bruce! You look cute...

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: (off clothes) Tommy Hilfiger. I'm hoping fourth year's a charm. He crosses his fingers and arms. Diane smiles. LISA runs frame and SHOVES Bruce to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: Outta my way, fag. I'm up. Humiliated, Bruce RUNS 0.S. Lisa takes his place, looks straight ahead and smiles, pompoms on hips.

dialogues.speaker: LISA, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: This really should have been my year. I had a lotta work done - I-I mean, y'know, I'd done a lotta work over the summer. Diane can't take her eyes off Lisa.

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: Lisa?... Is-is that you? LISA'S STUDENT I.D. drops INTO FRAME - her nose is big, s has no chin.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: (looks straight ahead) I lost a little weight.

dialogues.speaker: LISA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You could tell it made her nervous.  Diane shakes her head in disbelief and turns forward.

dialogues.speaker: DIANE/LISA
dialogues.text: Ready? (pompoms snap to waist) Okay! POMPOMS SNAP TO THIGHS and the CHEER BEGINS. Diane is effortless as she glides, jumps and smiles throu it - clearly better than Lisa.

dialogues.speaker: LISA, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: But they have to, y'know, spread the talent around, so I've been on the B squad for four years. CuT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa pushes the rest of the mug shots toward the FBI agen

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: Now, the squad as a whole? They're closer than Carolina cousins. Some people say they're, like, lezbos or something. But that's mostly just the yag-offs in band...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FIVE PAIR of LEGS with MATCHING ANKLETS and WHITE KEDS da from the stalls.

dialogues.speaker: LISA, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: ...truth is, they're so close - they all get their monthly visit from "Aunt Rose” at the same time. A HAND REACHES UNDER the first stall, PASSING A BOX OF TAMPONS to the next stall - and so on down the line.

dialogues.speaker: LISA, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: First, there's Hannah Wold...

dialogues.speaker: FIRST STALL DOOR
dialogues.text: HANNAH WOLD, a large, pretty girl in uniform, exits and  crosses to the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: LISA, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: She's their base. Strong as an ox. She's like this Uber-Christian - doesn't say much. I mean, if she wasn't kinda pretty, you'd go, "Hey, who's the tard?"

dialogues.speaker: NEXT STALL DOOR
dialogues.text: CLEO MILLE, pretty, starlet-type, wears plenty of make-up She lifts the front of her uniform sweater, holds it with teeth.

dialogues.speaker: LISA, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Then, there's Cleo Miller... She opens her purse, pulls out a gel breast and stuffs it one cup of her bra.

dialogues.speaker: LISA, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Number one - not a natural blonde. She REPEATS for the other breast, then pulls her sweater down.

dialogues.speaker: LISA, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: I know. I've been in the locker room and seen south of the border. Number two -- (whispers) She has to see the school shrink. Cleo lifts the back of her skirt - REVEALING CONAN O'BRIE face SILKSCREENED on her underpants (thought bubble above head reads "Friday... I love Cleo."). She KISSES HER HAND and plants it on his/her cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cleo sits in front of the SCHOOL COUNSELOR.

dialogues.speaker: CLEO
dialogues.text: Dreams? You mean, like, where I'm in Conan's all leather apartment - I don't know if he has one, that's why it's a dream - and suddenly we're buck-naked and all oiled up. I don't know where the oil comes from - again, that's why it's a dream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next STALL DOOR SHAKES, but DOESN'T OPEN.

dialogues.speaker: LISA, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: Cleo's weird, but Kansas Hill - that girl's crazy. HANDS APPEAR on top of the stall door - and KANSAS HILL petite, cute in a trashy, monster-truck-pull, kinda way - CRAWLS UNDER.

dialogues.speaker: KANSAS
dialogues.text: Son-of-a-blue-balled-bitch! I always get this one.

dialogues.speaker: LISA, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: Mouth on her that could stop a bull in heat. Gets her nut-brain from her mom. See, Mrs. Hill's been in prison since the day Kansas was born...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MRS. HILL'S blurry POV - from her hospital bed.

dialogues.speaker: LISA, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: She was lying there, in labor with Kansas, when she sees something going on in the next bed. Mrs. Hill's POV PANS LEFT - NEXT BED comes into focus.

dialogues.speaker: LISA, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Turns out it's Kansas' dad, uh, taking a nurse's temp. Stay with me, I'm trying to be delicate.

dialogues.speaker: FOCUS CLEARS
dialogues.text: In silhouette, a MAN is FUCKING a NURSE.

dialogues.speaker: LISA, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: So, Mrs. Hill whips out a shotgun and blows his ass to kingdom come. We see this - still in MRS. HILL'S POV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jury said, because the majority of women in Lincoln County having babies don't bring a shotgun, it counted as premeditation.

dialogues.speaker: LISA, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: She got life without parole, so Kansas lives with her grandparents. The next stall door opens and LUCY - cute, smart, very ti EXITS, suddenly stopping to look down.

dialogues.speaker: LISA, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Then there's Lucy... She takes out a WHITE-OUT BOTTLE and touches a spot on he already white Keds... stands... looks... then touches a s on the other shoe...

dialogues.speaker: LISA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Geek extraordinaire - a walking left brain. She's supposed to have this genius 1I.Q.? She then starts an obsessional frenzy of "whiting out" sp all over her Keds. DIANE exits the final stall and takes away Lucy's white-out.

dialogues.speaker: LISA, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Truth is, she's an obsessive-compulsive little freak.

dialogues.speaker: DIANE/LISA
dialogues.text: Hands in, ladies. Squad joins Diane in a circle, putting their hands over h hand - a la Madonna, backstage.

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: Today, we're going to cheer loud, jump high, and look pretty because --

dialogues.speaker: CHEER-LEADERS-KICK --
dialogues.text: IN ONE BEAT, ALL SWING RIGHT ARMS OVER HEAD, landing with SMACK on the "ASS" of the girl to their right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now let's get going - because nobody ever got ahead by sitting on their behind! As all run out, we:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PRINCIPAL SMITH, a man who burned out long ago, stands be a microphone on a small stage as he's done for 45 years. The LINCOLN HIGH "FIGHTIN' LOG" MASCOT (looks like an ang Tootsie Roll with legs and overly muscular arms) stands beside him, pantomiming everything he says. STUDENTS fill bleachers on either side.

dialogues.speaker: LISA, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: The school year started off like normal. Principal Smith gave his pep talk --

dialogues.speaker: PRINCIPAL SMITH
dialogues.text: (reading from a list) ... and if you are approached to buy drugs, let someone you trust know. If you are thinking of harming yourself or others, let someone know. If it burns when you urinate, have milky seepage or are being touched by an uncle - let someone know... Mascot looks at him, tries to pantomime.

dialogues.speaker: LISA, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: The A-squad performed... GYM LIGHTS GO DARK. STUDENTS SCREAM. DRUM CORP. and BRASS BAND start "ROCK & ROLL PART II" by Gary Glitter. The SPOTLIGHT RACES around the gym before it hits center court. The A-squad springs to their feet for an amazing cheer/dance - strong, sexy, acrobatic, non-traditional.

dialogues.speaker: LISA, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Now, I know it's my duty to give you all the facts, so I have to say that their cheer blew like a bulimic after Christmas dinner. Their blatant disregard for National High School Cheerleading Association rules made me sick. "Basket toss flips and wolf wall pyramids over two people high are strictly prohibited." I made a complete  report and sent it in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outside the gym doors.

dialogues.speaker: LISA, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: And finally, the football team was introduced.

dialogues.speaker: PRINCIPAL SMITH, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Transferring from Truman High, the new star quarter back of our mighty Fightin' Logs!

dialogues.speaker: LISA, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: That's when Jack and Diane met. Nobody saw it coming... CAMERA TURNS, PLAYERS head-butt and high-five CAMERA/Jack he starts through the door - looking around gym. SLOW MOT FREEZE-FRAME as the SPOTLIGHT HITS CAMERA/Jack.

dialogues.speaker: LISA, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Especially not Jack... SOUND DISTORTS. It's LOUD and CONFUSING. THROUGH IT, we s the A-squad running and doing back flips toward CAMERA/Ja As the squad nears CAMERA/Jack, SUDDENLY Diane's Ked-clad foot comes INTO FRAME and SMASHES INTO CAMERA/Jack.

dialogues.speaker: LISA, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: He fell for her hard. IRIS OPEN. DIANE hovers over CAMERA/Jack, apologizing, looking angelic. A-squad surrounds her. Suddenly a franti mascot breaks through, tips his log head back - IT'S BRUC (from try-outs) - mouthing "NOOOOOO!" He pulls CAMERA/Jac UP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mascot/Bruce as he drags his prize quarterback out of the gym. Jack and Diane's eyes never separate.

dialogues.speaker: LISA, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Jack was fine - oh man, was he fine. It  was like he was a bar of chocolate and the whole school was on the rag - everyone wanted a piece of him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Diane's mouth.

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: Jack Bartlett... Jack Bart-lett... Jack Bar-t-lett. She continues as we PULL BACK to REVEAL we're:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's an early 80's dream. The squad sits on their sleepin bags, in a circle, on the floor. They're painting nails, giving henna tattoos, streaking hair, etc. Hannah has a OUIJA BOARD in front of her, hands resting on the "MESSAG INDICATOR." Diane has her eyes closed.

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: ++. Ja-ck B-ar-t-le-tt... Is Jack Bartlett interested in me?

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: (nervous) I-I'm sorry - can someone else please run the Ouija board? It's creepy, it's wrong and it goes against the teachings of my Lord and Savior, Jesus Christ.

dialogues.speaker: KANSAS
dialogues.text: Hannah, in order to get real answers from the netherworld, you've gotta have a Christian virgin run the board. Your kind is pure of heart - the devil won't dick with you.

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: (looking down) Well technically, I don't think I'ma virgin anymore. Squad REACTS!

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Yeah. This summer at church camp? I'm pretty sure I had, y'know, an orgasm.

dialogues.speaker: KANSAS
dialogues.text: Hold up, hold up. Any sentence that starts with "at church camp" ain't leading to the big "0."

dialogues.speaker: CLEO
dialogues.text: That's not true. Those pictures of Christ - all sweaty and bare-chested on the cross - always kinda made me hot. Squad just stares at her.

dialogues.speaker: KANSAS
dialogues.text: Anyway, last time I checked, you still had to have sex to have an orgasm. And I know she ain't seen the lord on all fours - so I'm just saying.

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: Well, I want to know what happened --

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: Okay, one night, around sunset, I went horseback riding with the nuns. They went every night. And, well, we're trotting pretty hard, y'know? The hard leather saddle, pounding between my legs...

dialogues.speaker: CLEO
dialogues.text: I just got a little squishy...

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: All of a sudden, I feel... I feel... I feel just super alive... (whispering) "down there." I swear I thought it was the second coming.

dialogues.speaker: KANSAS
dialogues.text: Nope. Sounds more like the first.

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: (taking the hand-piece) I'll just ask the question myself... "Is Jack Bartlett interested in me?" As the hand-piece starts to move on the board, we:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack (with a red Ked print on his cheek) stands with THRE FOOTBALL PLAYERS looking under the hood of his '75 GTO. They've all got one hand in back pocket, the other wrapp around a beer.

dialogues.speaker: FOOTBALL PLAYER
dialogues.text: You do the bondo yourself?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: FOOTBALL PLAYER
dialogues.text: Sure-is-sweet.

dialogues.speaker: FOOTBALL PLAYER
dialogues.text: What'll she do?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Never opened her up.

dialogues.speaker: FOOTBALL PLAYER
dialogues.text: S-weet.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Who was the girl who kicked me in the head yesterday?

dialogues.speaker: FOOTBALL PLAYER
dialogues.text: Diane Weston.

dialogues.speaker: FOOTBALL PLAYER
dialogues.text: Now she sure is sweet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SIGN hangs above the stage. "HOMECOMING KING AND QUEEN CANDIDATES." A row of STUDENT CANDIDATES, including Jack Diane and Lisa, sit behind a BUTCH GIRL at the podium.

dialogues.speaker: LISA, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: Look, I'll be honest with you. Most of us realized we didn't have a whore's chance in heaven with Jack the day of candidate speeches. As the Butch Girl concludes her speech, she holds a sign her head which reads, "4-H - A WAY OF LIFE!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A GEEKY GUY stands at the podium.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the A.V. Club candidate, I think, for the first time in fifty years, we should say -- (nervous) NO to a football player as king! Two HIGH-PITCHED MALE VOICES cheer 0O.S.

dialogues.speaker: GEEKY GUY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Vote brains over braun! A FOOTBALL flies INTO FRAME, hitting Geeky Guy on the FOREHEAD .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack stands at the podium, unable to speak because the CR IS CHEERING! He's handsome as hell, sweet and genuine. Yo can't help but love him and you really want to fuck him.

dialogues.speaker: LISA, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: It was the first time most of us even heard Jack speak.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Whoa...Thanks, uh - WOW. Uh, hey alright...okay, uh --

dialogues.speaker: LISA, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: We weren't disappointed.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Guys! Hey, guys! Shut up a minute. The crowd QUIETS down.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Well, uh, I think it just really rocks that the football team picked me as their, y'know, uh, candidate. FOOTBALL PLAYERS AD-LIB "Yeah! Whoa Kick ass!"

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE VOICES
dialogues.text: We love you, Jack!

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Hey, well, I love you lunch ladies! Audience LAUGHS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just want to say that there are only three things I want in life - to someday become a senator of this great state... Audience CHEERS.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I want to lead the Lincoln High Fightin' Logs to victory at the homecoming game -- Audience CHEERS!

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay, okay... Uh, and I... I want to go to the homecoming dance with Diane Weston. STUNNED SILENCE. Diane stares at him. Lisa looks pissed. The school SUDDENLY ERUPTS with CHEERS! Jack turns to Dia She runs up to the podium. They hug and kiss.

dialogues.speaker: LISA, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: Ucht! They were like friggin' Barbie and Ken, but without the pink, remote control Corvette. Overnight people were going, like --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Average GIRL faces CAMERA - MOUTHING:

dialogues.speaker: LISA, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: "Oh, they're the perfect couple!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANOTHER average GIRL faces CAMERA - MOUTHING:

dialogues.speaker: LISA, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: "They're so cuuuuuuuuute!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Geeky Guy sits alone, typing frantically at his computer, stopping occasionally to push up his glasses.

dialogues.speaker: LISA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I'm sure it gave the internet whacks something to talk about besides Agent Scully and their most recent wet dream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack and Diane are still in a love-lock.

dialogues.speaker: LISA, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: Now, I'm not one to gossip, but I think Jack and Diane got so close so fast because they discovered how much they both loved...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janitorial Closet Door. An excited Diane and Jack meet in front of it, kiss and roll into the closet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A CLIMBING ROPE hangs in the middle of the shot. Suddenly disheveled Jack slides down. A beat later, Diane follows. They kiss and part ways - dropping hands at the last minu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Door. Red-faced Jack and Diane peek out, look to see they alone, kiss good-bye, then head off in opposite direction DOOR CLOSES to reveal a sign "Principal Smith."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's COLD and LOUD. Starting on his own 10 YARD LINE, Jac takes the hike, looks left, right - pumps once - twice - NOTHING. He bursts through the line, dodging - weaving - leaping over his opponents.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE CLOCK
dialogues.text: 15 seconds...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: holding their breath, pompons at the ready. Mascot runs p them, pantomiming "nervous" to the crowd by biting his na and knocking his knees.

dialogues.speaker: ON JACK
dialogues.text: as he reaches the line of scrimmage. There's ONE DEFENDER LEFT. Jack fakes left, right - takes the tackle - but manages to roll out of it! HE-COULD-GO-ALL-THE...

dialogues.speaker: ON THE CROWD
dialogues.text: They're going wild!

dialogues.speaker: ON THE A-SQUAD
dialogues.text: running along the sideline - Diane leading the way!

dialogues.speaker: ON JACK
dialogues.text: he looks right - sees Diane and mouths "I love you!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Diane mouths "I love you!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack makes the touchdown, spikes the ball, and starts a s run toward us - arms outstretched. WE run toward him in S MOTION. SUDDENLY a WALL OF PLAYERS enter frame and tackle him in celebration. END MUSIC.

dialogues.speaker: LISA, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: Now, right about here's where the real shit started to hit the fan... Don't worry - I'll clean this up a bit if I have to appear in court -- especially if we're on "Court TV."

dialogues.speaker: SFX
dialogues.text: DENNIS WESTON (Diane's Dad) opens the door while DEEDEE (Diane's Mom) FLASHES a PHOTO of a surprised Jack and his parents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, there's a Christmas card.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Come in, come in... All enter the FOYER. Jack looks gorgeous in his tux. His parents are just like Diane's - mid-40's housewife and mi management drone. Their children are their lives.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Say Jack, why don't you go light a fire under Diane.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I'm on it, Mr. Weston. Jack smiles and bounds up the stairs - two at a time.

dialogues.speaker: DEEDEE
dialogues.text: Oh - say, where're my manners. I'm DeeDee - you can remember me because of my double "D's." She LAUGHS with Dennis as if it's the first time she's sa it. We see where Diane gets her perk - and her body.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: And I'm Diane's Dad, Dennis. Do not try that after one of my Screwdrivers! Dennis and DeeDee LAUGH again.

dialogues.speaker: DEEDEE
dialogues.text: (recovering) Whoooo - now who wants some pigs-in-a blanket?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vanity mirror. Diane is putting on lip gloss - she looks beautiful in her gown. We see JACK ENTER in the b.g. She turns. He reacts to her beauty.

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: Hi, Jack.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Excuse me, Vendela, have you seen Diane? We're supposed to go to the homecoming  dance tonight. Diane LAUGHS. They move in for a hormonally driven kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All are seated. The women are enjoying pigs-in-a-blanket while the men suck back screwdrivers.

dialogues.speaker: LISA, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: I obviously wasn't there the night they all met, but it was probably a super goober fest. DeeDee enthusiastically MOUTHS the following:

dialogues.speaker: LISA, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: (mocking DeeDee's voice) "Your Jack's one heck of a good football player." Jack's Dad MOUTHS the following:

dialogues.speaker: LISA, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: (mocking Jack's Dad's voice) "IT don't know how he can concentrate with your lovely Diane cheering on the sidelines?!" They all LAUGH.

dialogues.speaker: LISA, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: "Ha, ha, ha, ha..." Ucht! Jack and Diane enter the holding hands. DeeDee goes crazy FLASHING PHOTOS. All AD-LIB adoration.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Hold on a minute. Hold on. I have an announcement. Jack puts his arm around Diane - they're beaming.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Me and Diane, uh... we decided we're going to get married. The parents react with shock, then absolute joy! DeeDee starts to cry - turning the CAMERA on HERSELF.

dialogues.speaker: DEEDEE
dialogues.text: Oh, oh, mother of the bride - I'm  allowed!

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: But not before... I have our baby. All FREEZE - the calm before the shit storm. Suddenly, Jack's Mom throws her head back and lets out a BLOOD CURD SCREAM.

dialogues.speaker: JACK AND DIANE'S STUNNED FACES
dialogues.text: PULL BACK to REVEAL we're:

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: .».. SO when your dad said, "I never want to see your "f-'in' faces again!" do you think he meant forever or just until your mom wakes up?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I don't know... And what the hell was that sound she made right before she hit the coffee table.

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: Well, if I had to guess... (convincing self) I'd say that was the sound of a mother saying good-bye to her little boy and hello to a young man who's going to be a daddy of his own... (getting an idea, cradling his face) Jack, do you know what I see here?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Spit from your dad?

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: (wiping his hair) I see a flower. And y'know, even the most beautiful flowers still grow from dirt.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: So, while we're knee deep in right now - and things seem pretty "stinky" - in the long run, we're going to grow strong from this.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Y'think?

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: I sure do. BEAT.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: (trust and love in his eyes) Diane, I've loved you ever since I first Saw you -- right before you kicked me in the head.

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: (touched) Oh, Jack... As they move in for a kiss, we:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack and Diane are on stage, wearing crowns and large vel robes - they turn and wave! They won! They appear to be floating on a sea of balloons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FIVE PAIR of LEGS with HIGH HEELS dangle from the STALLS. (We've seen this shot before.) MUSIC from the dance press through the walls. A HAND REACHES UNDER the first stall, PASSING A BOX OF TAMPONS to the next stall.

dialogues.speaker: LISA, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: Diane must've told her squad that night. BOX OF TAMPONS CONTINUES down the line - UNTIL THE LAST STALL. Diane's hand comes down and pushes the TAMPONS BAC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in last stall) No thanks - don't need one. FIRST STALL DOOR FILES OPEN, followed by the SECOND, THIR it sticks, Kansas climbs over - and FOURTH! (Cleo exits fixing her gel breast.) The squad surrounds Diane's stall door. She finally exits.

dialogues.speaker: DIANE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (looking at everyone a beat) So... Stunned silence.

dialogues.speaker: LISA, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: I'm sure they were thrilled. I mean, if Diane said jump, they'd say "Double Dutch," "Shoot the Moon," or "Split Russian?" Suddenly, everyone starts talking at once.

dialogues.speaker: CLEO
dialogues.text: Holy shit.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: You just became a statistic!

dialogues.speaker: KANSAS
dialogues.text: (suddenly happy) Oh my G-d! I'm not first!

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: But you're not married.

dialogues.speaker: CLEO
dialogues.text: Wait! Did you say you are pregnant or you were pregnant... You had it, threw it out and you're gonna go back and dance all night!

dialogues.speaker: KANSAS
dialogues.text: Shut up, Cleo. Di, how much do you need for an abortion?

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: (suddenly freaked) What?! No! Not an abortion! My church can arrange for you to go to Oregon and take care of a "sick aunt" for nine months. Then they put your baby good  home and you come back - a little dazed and puffy - but everything's fine! Oh please, Di, don't be a whore and a murderer! All FREEZE - no one can believe she just said that.

dialogues.speaker: LISA, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: Jack told the team that night, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack and a bunch of FOOTBALL PLAYERS in tuxes stand at th urinals, BACKS TO CAMERA.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Hey, guys? Uh, I got Diane pregnant.

dialogues.speaker: FOOTBALL PLAYER
dialogues.text: What?! Well - all right! He HIGH-FIVES Jack with his free hand.

dialogues.speaker: FOOTBALL PLAYER
dialogues.text: You nailed Diane Weston? I'd never wash my Johnson again! He HIGH-FIVES Jack on the other side with his free hand a the OTHER FOOTBALL PLAYERS also HIGH-FIVE each other. The all freak out when they realize they are touching each ot while PEEING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All still stare at Hannah

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: I-I didn't mean to say "whore," Diane. I just hear it so much at church - it kinda came flying out of my head.

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: I know, Hannah. Look, I'm not going to get an abortion. I mean, I always planned to get married and have kids - I'm just going a little out of order. Kinda reminds me of another young lady who found herself "with child," unmarried, on a long road, with no place to sleep. "Course, that was a long-long  time ago. But no matter what, she held her head high and said... "Pappa don't preach, I'm in trouble deep. Pappa don't preach, 'cause I'm keepin' my baby. Hey. I'm gonna keep my baby." The great one... All take hands and lower their heads.

dialogues.speaker: DIANE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (with reverence) Madonna.

dialogues.speaker: KANSAS
dialogues.text: We're here for you, Diane. All move in to hug her.

dialogues.speaker: LISA, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: I guess their little fairy tale could've ended there, "And they lived happily ever after." Only problem was... (with great joy, laughing) they didn't have a place to live!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack and Diane sit in front of an older LOAN OFFICER'S de SIGN READS: "Your home for home loans." Loan officer look over papers as Jack and Diane look excitedly at one anoth Diane takes Jack's hand.

dialogues.speaker: LOAN OFFICER
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: What?! But all our paperwork's there. My school records, Jack's football records...

dialogues.speaker: LOAN OFFICER
dialogues.text: Let me explain something...

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: No. Wait! Did I say Promise! Cross-my heart and hope-to-die, stick-a-needle-in my-eye we'll never miss a payment?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, yes. Yes you did.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Diane. Hold on a minute. I think I know where this is going. (sotto, to loan officer) I'm willing to put up the papers for my Mustang - she's got a few miles on her, but she looks great.

dialogues.speaker: LOAN OFFICER
dialogues.text: I'm sure, son, but --

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Okay! Stop twisting my arm! I'll throw in the speakers.

dialogues.speaker: LOAN OFFICER
dialogues.text: Look, kids, why don't you just have your parents come in and get a loan? Then they could give you the money.

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: (building from a slow burn) With all due respect, Jack and Diane Bartlett... They exchange a smile, first time saying this.

dialogues.speaker: DIANE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ...do not accept charity. We are two young, able-bodied Americans. We do not want a handout. We want a hand-up. Give us food and we will be hungry tomorrow. Give us corn - the kind you plant, not eat - and we'll grow our own food and... and, uh, then cut it, and - uh, y'know eat it! Now, if you're interested in giving us a home loan, I will sit back down. If not, have a nice day, Ma'am.

dialogues.speaker: LOAN OFFICER
dialogues.text: Sorry. My hands are tied. Diane makes a dramatic exit, taking a handful of M&M's fr her desk. The squad, (previously unidentified) lounging i the central bank of couches, follows her.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: (watching proudly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A smiling Jack and Diane as they look lovingly into each other's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: Well... it's a little more than we wanted to spend, but we'll take it! They kiss. PULL BACK to REVEAL we're:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a semi-furnished shit-hole. The ONLY WINDOW looks ou on a BRICK WALL. The APARTMENT MANAGER, a grungy, Tommy L type, paces.

dialogues.speaker: APARTMENT MANAGER
dialogues.text: Fine. Just remember, I manage the building. I don't, like, own it or fix it. So, like, I don't care if shit breaks. All I care is that the rent is shoved under my door on the first. Oh, and if there's, like, packages outside my door? Leave ‘em the hell alone. He exits. Jack and Diane are not listening - lost in each others' eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack, in uniform, stands behind the counter.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: (stilted) Welcome to Burger Bin. (sotto) Don't get the Filet-O-Fish - the fry cook picks his ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An ANGRY COOK standing behind Jack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack, in uniform, behind the counter. He looks confused a he presses buttons on his high-tech register.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: (accenting Spanish words) Two Taco Grannnndes, one burrrrrrito, large ta-co chips and guacamooooooole...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack stands at the counter - in uniform.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: (sotto to customer) We don't really have fried rats in the buckets - I know, I checked.

dialogues.speaker: SAME SCENE
dialogues.text: PULL BACK to reveal a long line waiting.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: (looking up from register) That'll be...uh, thirty five cents, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack stands at the counter, in sailor uniform. An OLD NAV MAN, all in white, stands in the B.G. cleaning his nails a knife.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: (nervous, looks over shoulder Welcome to Dinkie's Donuts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hurt and angry Jack walks in, still in sailor uniform. Diane's in bed eating and doing homework.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Dinkie is a bad, bad man...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack stands in front of the counter, THREE SOCIAL RETARDS (Jack's age) behind it. Jack hands them his application.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: (defeated) Y'know what? I'll save you the time. I'm not going to lie. I don't believe in it. If you pick your ass - I'm going to tell people. I have no idea how to run your registers. And, if any of you are hard core drinkers and like to throw knives, well, I'm outta here right now.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Uh, are, uh, you-you're Jack Bartlett right?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: You'd be, like, hangin' out with us every night after school, right?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Yeah - well, after football practice.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: (savoring the words) Football practice - fantasmic. The social retards look at each other, excited.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: You're hired!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUZAK UP. A worried Diane, now showing slightly under all black warm-ups, is writing on her notepad as she walks do an aisle. Suddenly, in the B.G. CROSS AISLE, an ecstatic Jack, in "Video Barn" uniform, WHIZZES PAST, riding his c Arms out at his sides.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I'm on top of the world! Seeing Diane, he tries to stop, but can't and continues p A SECOND LATER, he scrambles back and rides up to her - tossing more boxes into the already FULL CART.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (holding box of cookies) Hey, Di, if we have a girl, we should dress her like Little Debbie! Jack pulls alongside Diane and kisses her. She notices th full cart. It'll cost a fortune.

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: Jack, sweetie, I'm only eating for two.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: (positively giddy) But Di, all this food reminds me of how much I want to teach our baby. He tosses more cereal in the cart. Diane looks at her notepad, then starts to return items to the shelves WITHO JACK NOTICING.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Like Cocoa Puffs. Good. Captain Crunch. Bad. Shreds the roof of your mouth. I mean you hear, "Tricks are for kids!" And you think, "I'm a kid, I guess they're for me." But your baby brain's got no idea that Fruit Loops are, like, a million times better. I'm going to save our kid all that pain.

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: Jack...

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: (putting all three in cart) If you could be Count Chocula  Frankenberry or Trix the Rabbit, who'd you be?

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: (removing the box) Trix...

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Me too! Will it ever end?! (yelling to the store) I love this lady! He kisses her as SHE SLIPS ANOTHER BOX on the shelf.

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: Jack, I think I should get a job.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: (rubbing her belly) But we agreed your job is running the baby machine...

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: I know, but that was before.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Ah! I almost forgot gas for the baby machine. I'll grab your Snickers and get a place in line. He kisses her again and runs off. Diane watches him - the love in her eyes quickly turns back to worry and she star to put everything back on the shelves: cookies, cereal, chips, ice cream - oh, that struggle, but it goes...

dialogues.speaker: AISLE
dialogues.text: Diane emerges with an almost empty cart. Just milk, peanu butter, bread and a large roast are all that remain.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hey, Di! Diane turns to see Jack, a couple aisles over, holding ou LITTLE KID WITH GLASSES.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (in a funny voice) Hello, I'm the little professor. Wouldn't it be cute if ours looked like  this?! A WOMAN RUSHES over and ANGRILY grabs her kid back from J punches him and storms off. Diane rushes in line, ditchin the roast in a gum rack beside the check-out. As she struggles with it, she notices a WOMAN at the LINC SAVINGS AND LOANS BRANCH (inside the Safeway at the end o the check-out aisles) putting out a HELP WANTED sign.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack drives as Diane devours a king size Snickers bar.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I never knew you dreamed of working in a grocery store bank branch. Baby, we are living the great American Dream!

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: (mouth full of Snickers) Mmm-hmmm. . . Unseen by Jack, Diane slips her hand out the partially op window, releasing a PAGE from her NOTEPAD. On the BLOWING LIST as the Mustang drives on:

dialogues.speaker: DIANE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (mouth full) If you reach for the stars, you're bound to get -- mm-Jack, pull over.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Huh? Oh Jesus...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls over.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Why do they call it morning sickness? In the UNFOCUSED B.G., Diane opens her door and crawls ou about to toss her cookies. In the F.G., the LIST settles the road: FROM THE BEAUTIFUL MIND OF DIANE is a pre-print on the top. Diane wrote "Monthly Income" column which tot "S525." Her "Monthly Bills" column totals "$845." "ONE MONTH LEFT" is scribbled at the bottom.

dialogues.speaker: A FISH
dialogues.text: In the seafood case. The BUTCHER's hand comes in, takes i out, and flops it on the scale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oscillating fan behind him. Follow the smell as it drifts from the counter over to Diane, working in the Bank Branc She sniffs, sniffs again, then suddenly gags and goes dow behind the counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Diane's belly. Jack's HAND comes into frame, tracing it against the wall. PULL BACK as DIANE steps away. We SEE T LINES labelled, "AUGUST" and "SEPTEMBER" on the wall. The smile and kiss.

dialogues.speaker: SLOW MOTION
dialogues.text: The squad, in uniform, walks toward camera in a line acro the hall - looking cool as hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Squad walks away. An ADDITIONAL PIECE OF FABRIC has been added to the back of Diane's skirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack and Diane open the front door. The BUILDING MANAGER pushes in a big screen TV. MUSIC UNDER.

dialogues.speaker: BUILDING MANAGER
dialogues.text: I need a place to keep this. Anyone asks, what d'ya know? You don't know shit. SCHOOL BAND MUSIC UP. Jack and Diane hug each other, they have a TV!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack hikes the ball, steps back to throw, but trips on h shoe laces.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE CROWD
dialogues.text: All are silent. A HECKLER STANDS.

dialogues.speaker: HECKLER
dialogues.text: Hey, Bartlett, pick up your skirt when you run!

dialogues.speaker: ON THE SQUAD
dialogues.text: Watching from the field. Diane turns to the crowd. Jack's heckler must die!

dialogues.speaker: KANSAS
dialogues.text: (yelling to heckler) Run, you bastard, run! She's hormonal!! Diane's off, SCALING THE BLEACHERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FANS ARE GONE. A beat-up Jack, helmet under arm, walks wi his arms around Diane, who's icing her fist. He smiles an kisses her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Diane's belly. Jack's hand comes into frame, tracing it.

dialogues.speaker: PULL BACK
dialogues.text: as Diane steps away. We see THREE LINES: "August", "September" and "October" already written on the wall. Th smile and kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack and the social retards.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: ...she's in my hands, right? Moist to the touch. It's at that moment I think I control her - she's mine. But it's a false illusion, like in "Backdraft." No  man controls fire! She's ready, I'm ready, she's ready, I yell, "One-fifty four, forty eight."

dialogues.speaker: PULL BACK
dialogues.text: to reveal he's holding a football.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hike! The social retards are orgasmic over his story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUZAK UP. Diane, at the service window, smiles as she hel a CUSTOMER, then drops her pen behind the counter, mouthi "Ooops, one moment." She bends down.

dialogues.speaker: BEHIND THE COUNTER
dialogues.text: Diane voraciously rips the top off a SNICKERS and shoves into a jar of HAAGENDAAZ. She takes a huge bite, then pop up, SMILING - MOUTH FULL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Squad is looking over different pregnancy books. Cleo rea from a TEEN LOOKING MAGAZINE.

dialogues.speaker: CLEO
dialogues.text: I can't believe they have the "Top Ten Alternatives to Sex for You and Your Boyfriend" and "watching each other masturbate" isn't even listed! All stare at her a beat.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: (off pregnancy book) Diane, it says here you're going to have mood swings, uncontrollable gas.

dialogues.speaker: KANSAS
dialogues.text: More proof God's a guy...

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: ...and sex dreams where you actually have an orgasm!

dialogues.speaker: KANSAS
dialogues.text: Virgin Mary musta snuck that one in.  Hannah hits Kansas. MUSIC TURNS TO SLOWER MINOR CHORDS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Same SLOW MOTION scene. Squad walks TOWARD CAMERA in line across the hall - again looking cool as hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A larger piece of fabric has been added to the back of Diane's skirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Diane (eating Snickers) sits in the bean-bag chair in fro of the BIG SCREEN TV. Jack stands beside it, holding a video, "ANIMAL BIRTHS." He smiles and puts it in the VCR. Under OPENING CREDITS a KITTEN IS BEING BORN. Jack is horrified by it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack, LOOKING TIRED, is doing homework at the counter wit the social retards. (Store is decorated for Christmas.)

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: Jack, c'mon, you promised.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: (yawning) Okay, one question.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: (to other social retards) Oh, me-me-me, mine's great.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: Proceed, Dungeon Master Quan. Lisa approaches the counter, VIDEO TAPES in hand.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Okay. Jack, y'know how you and Diane... slept together? (looking to tards, pleased with himself) Well now that you can't, y'know, (fuck) "sleep together," but you still sleep together, don't you ever get, like, just, super horny? If so, how horny? I'll be quiet now so I can listen to  your answer.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: (flirting her ass off) Yeah, Jack - I'd love to hear your answer. She sets her videos on the counter, smiling seductively. Jack starts to run them under the scanner.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: The answer's easy... (quickly) Oh, "Lolita" is due tomorrow - Same for "9 1/2 Weeks." Ditto on "Wild Things." (back to question) I'm gonna be a dad! Dads don't get horny. Lisa grabs her tapes and exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Diane's belly. Jack's HAND comes into frame, tracing it. ICE CREAM drips on it. Jack licks it off as we PULL BACK to see a VERY TIRED Dia holding a pint of ice cream, using a SNICKERS as a spoon. FOUR lines labelled "August," "September," "October" and "November" on the wall. Jack gives Diane a tired peck on cheek as she continues to eat.

dialogues.speaker: ON CROWD
dialogues.text: As they TURN FLASH CARDS IN UNISON to read: "2-4-6-8 LOGS

dialogues.speaker: ON SQUAD
dialogues.text: going nuts! They notice Diane isn't there. She's eating a vendor's box. They run over to her.

dialogues.speaker: ON JACK
dialogues.text: running for a touchdown - a la his homecoming run. This t he's exhausted and the competition is gaining. Everything grinds to a SLO-MO CRAWL as Jack makes a heroi leap for the touchdown. With his spare hand, he attempts smother a huge yawn, as opposing players come flying at from both sides.

dialogues.speaker: BED
dialogues.text: Continuation of pervious shot as Jack lands on the bed completing the touchdown. Diane falls across the frame fr the opposite side. They're asleep by the time they hit th bed - still in cheerleading and football uniforms. Jack holds a large STATE TROPHY - Diane holds a half-eaten Snickers.

dialogues.speaker: LISA, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: Okay, so they won state - b.f.d. The best part was Diane was really starting to look like shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Diane's face - smashed against A SIDE GLASS PANEL as she SLEEPS. She really does look like shit - puffy eyes, no m up, dark circles, bad hair and drool coming from her mout

dialogues.speaker: LUCY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Diane? Diane!

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: (waking up) Huh-ha-wha? (scratching on window) Ahh! I'm under the ice! I'm uh -- oh...man... (opening her window) That was a weird one.

dialogues.speaker: PULL BACK
dialogues.text: To REVEAL the squad stands in front of Diane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another sex dream?

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: Wayne Gretzky.

dialogues.speaker: KANSAS
dialogues.text: Hat-trick?

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: (exhausted) He is the Great One...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack is asleep on his books at the small children's furniture, set up beside the children's voices. Lisa approaches.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: (sweetly) Jack? Oh Jack... Ted approaches.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Can I help you?

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: (loud whisper) Get your loser ass away from me! Ted exits. Lisa looks around, then walks over and kicks t chair out from under Jack's head, sending him crashing to floor.

dialogues.speaker: LISA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh my G-d - are you okay? She immediately kneels beside him, placing his aching hea her lap - smothering him in her breasts.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: (groggily reaching up) Diane? Lisa stands, dropping him from her lap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's pitch black. We hear a KEY IN THE DOOR. It opens, a arm comes in and the LIGHT GOES ON. An exhausted Diane an the squad, carrying things for the sleep-over, enter. LUC carries a pizza box. THE PLACE IS A PIT. All but Diane STOP, IN SHOCK.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: Oh my G-d, you've been robbed!

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: (tired and depressed) No...I've been pregnant.

dialogues.speaker: CLEO
dialogues.text: Di, are you okay? We can skip the girl party this week.

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: (unconvincing) Everything's fine. I'm just having a little trouble keeping my frown upside down. Diane forces a smile.

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: You want us to help you pick up?

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: (snapping) Don't Martha-fucking-Stewart me! If you don't like it - you try being a pregnant teen! Diane YANKS the Safeway bag from Hannah and storms 0.S.

dialogues.speaker: KANSAS
dialogues.text: And we have our first pregnancy mood swing. All that's left is -- Diane FARTS 0O.C.

dialogues.speaker: KANSAS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Bingo.

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: Squad sits in a cleared space in front of the BIG TV,  painting nails, reading magazines, etc. Diane eats.

dialogues.speaker: CLEO
dialogues.text: Did you guys hear that in China - or one a those places that makes the really cheap silk shoes and kids are super smart - that as a reward for good grades, mothers get their kids hookers to blow 'em? All stop and look at her.

dialogues.speaker: CLEO
dialogues.text: Huh. Musta been a dream.

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: I'm sorry to keep asking this, but are you guys sure I'm not fat? Squad looks to each other, nervous, then AD-LIBS "No!"

dialogues.speaker: DIANE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: "No" you're not sure or "No" I'm not fat?

dialogues.speaker: KANSAS
dialogues.text: Uh, "no"... You're not fat.

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: You sure I'm not fat?

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: (can't take it any more) Look, you're fat, Diane. You're fat, fat, fat! Because you eat, eat, eat! (to shocked squad) What?! She keeps asking because she wants some honesty.

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: (breaking down) No I don't... I keep asking because I feel fat.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: Oh G-d, I'm sorry... You're not really fat! I was just saying that because, uh, I thought that's what you wanted me to say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure?

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: Positive.

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: "Positive" you're sure I'm not fat or "positive" I'm...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Squad is watching "POINT BREAK" on TV: Bank Robbery about start. Diane eats Snickers.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: Oh my G-d, I read about this! It's called a "pregnancy insanity." Quick she needs a sitz bath --

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: (putting down her Snickers) Look, I might be moody. I might be gassy. But I am perfectly sane. Think about it. In school, they tell us, "Dreams can come true." Right? Squad AD-LIBS agreement - not knowing where this is going

dialogues.speaker: DIANE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But they don't tell us how! Well thanks to Keanu, I figured it out! Money makes your dreams come true. Squad AD-LIBS their concern for her mental health.

dialogues.speaker: DIANE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (old spirit returning) Listen, Kansas, I know you dream of springing your mom some day...

dialogues.speaker: KANSAS
dialogues.text: Stop, you're gonna make me cry.

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: And if the 0.J. trial taught us anything, it taught us that in America, you can cut off someone's head and still be found innocent if you have enough  money. Your mom only shot a guy... Kansas smiles at the thought.

dialogues.speaker: DIANE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now Cleo, I know you dream of an all leather apartment with Conan - I heard the school shrink telling a lunch lady. Cleo blushes and smiles guiltily at the thought.

dialogues.speaker: DIANE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And Hannah, you could give your share to your church - or maybe buy one of those hungry little kids Sally Struthers advertises.

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: Or, I could get my own horse...

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: Or that! Look, you guys, I just want to provide a future for my baby. I know my bank branch like the back of my puffy little hand. I could open that safe in my sleep!

dialogues.speaker: KANSAS
dialogues.text: I'm in. Squad reacts with SHOCK - did she just say that?

dialogues.speaker: KANSAS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I mean it. I'min. This is the closest thing to a goddamn family that I've ever had. If one of us needs something, we all do.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: Stop it! This is crazy!

dialogues.speaker: CLEO
dialogues.text: I'm in, too.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: Cleo!

dialogues.speaker: CLEO
dialogues.text: Kansas is right. We're like sisters -- we're closer than sisters. And you don't turn your back on family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, Luce, people do it in the movies all the time.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: And they get caught!

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: That's right. So all we have to do is watch a bunch of movies and learn from their mistakes.

dialogues.speaker: CLEO
dialogues.text: And you know real cops aren't half as smart as Keanu.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: Forget it. I've got a scholarship to Harvard hanging over my head. I won't risk it.

dialogues.speaker: CLEO
dialogues.text: (sotto, to Kansas) Conan went to Harvard.

dialogues.speaker: KANSAS
dialogues.text: (sotto) Shut up.

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: Lucy, do you know for sure you're going to get that scholarship?

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: If you don't - can you still afford to go to Harvard?

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: ».. I don't know. Probably not.

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: So then this isn't crazy. It's a sure bet.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: Well... Squad AD-LIBS their encouragement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess we're in this together. They jump around, thrilled.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But, we have to make a smart plan!

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: Of course - of course! Hands in... Squad puts their hands in.

dialogues.speaker: DIANE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We all have to cross-our-hearts-hope-to die-stick-a-dirty-needle-in-my-eye that we'll never tell Jack. We all know he can't lie - that's why he's going to be such a great senator.

dialogues.speaker: MUSIC UP
dialogues.text: as the squad goes through their "Cheerleaders Kick Ass!" routine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It looks just like Diane's basement. Cleo sits on the cou eating from a bag of microwave popcorn. The VIDEO BOX for "Reservoir Dogs" plays in the tiny picture-in-picture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is neatly ordered. Lucy sits at her computer - D case of "Heat" sits beside her monitor. She's taking copi notes. Her mom enters with milk and cookies. Lucy stands, concealing her monitor. Her mom sets down the cookies and kisses Lucy's good-night before she exits. Relieved, Lucy sits at her computer again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a sparse room, filled with religious icons. Hannah nervously places a video into the VCR above the TV, then on the couch. She smiles about to push PLAY on the remote when her stern, UBER-CHRISTIAN PARENTS ENTER and take a s on either side of her. Her look turns to fear as her fat takes the remote and hits PLAY. END MUSIC.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA TRACKS down the hallway, passing groups of kids as they talk beside their lockers. We pass the GEEKY GUY (fr "Candidate Speeches") and his two friends.

dialogues.speaker: GEEKY GUY
dialogues.text: ... I feel utterly abandoned in a place that values physical prowess over mental acuity. I can't wait for all this to change once we get in the real world... CONTINUE TRACKING PAST LISA and the B-squad.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: ... I do! I totally marry Prince William even if he was gay. I mean, in England all guys are kinda gay anyway. Even cigarettes are fags over there... B-squad AD-LIBS AGREEMENT as we CONTINUE to the A-squad around Diane's locker.

dialogues.speaker: CLEO
dialogues.text: ...He slices off the guy's ear, and I mean you see everything - the bloody pink hole where the --

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: Cleo, I've already thrown up twice today - could you please get to any relevant part of the movie?

dialogues.speaker: CLEO
dialogues.text: (vamping) Well...uh...they, y'know, uh... They had nicknames.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Squad sits at their lunch table in this large, open room. Only Diane eats - from all the trays. Lucy walks around table, handing out stapled packets.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: ...Page one is a plot summary of "Heat." Two has my character summaries. Three is my overall critique and on four through ten, you'll find my Nexus search of all prior analysis of this film... All stare at her. She stops - starts to pick up the packe

dialogues.speaker: LUCY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Uh, in summation, no part of "Heat" is really applicable to a grocery store bank branch robbery.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: What the heck is going on here? All turn to see Jack, followed by football players and th Video Barn Geeks.

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: Uh, Jack - look, I can explain...

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Diane, there's no excuse for not taking your pre-natal vitamins. Now, if you guys were really friends, you'd remind her to take these. He smiles, gives Diane her vitamins and kisses her head before exiting to the "jock table."

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Uh, Cleo...would you just say my name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The squad, in uniform, sits along the wall. Pregnant COUP fill the rest of the room.

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: ...so, while it's a laugh riot for the whole family, and Tim Conway is just about as funny as they come, especially when he goes...

dialogues.speaker: KANSAS
dialogues.text: Wait a minute. You watched the Apple fucking-Dumpling Gang?!

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: I'm only allowed "G" movies.

dialogues.speaker: KANSAS
dialogues.text: (losing it) Am I the only one who cares about this? At least I watched "Dog Day Afternoon!"

dialogues.speaker: HUSBAND
dialogues.text: Excuse me, could you please keep your voice down? We're not introducing anger into the womb.

dialogues.speaker: KANSAS
dialogues.text: (snapping back) Well how'd you like me to introduce my foot into your ass?

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: Kansas!

dialogues.speaker: KANSAS
dialogues.text: (lowering her voice) I'm sorry, Diane, but I'm not gonna watch my dreams fade away 'cause the Virgin Mary here thinks she's gonna get ideas from kiddie movies --

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: Those of us who have parents, know that they have rules because they care! All fall silent - she went too far. Kansas stands.

dialogues.speaker: KANSAS
dialogues.text: You sure you wanna go there?

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: (nervously standing) Uh...maybe?

dialogues.speaker: KANSAS
dialogues.text: "Cause I will Jerry Springer you faster than you can say "Fat-assed lesbian!" Kansas and Hannah go at it - the GIRL FIGHT is on. Diane, Cleo and Lucy try to pull them apart, AD-LIBBING "Stop!" "Knock it off!" A NURSE enters from the other side of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Diane Weston? Diane pushes her way through the fight, forcing a smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A disheveled squad enters to find Diane on the exam table crying. Her sweater is pulled up, pregnant belly exposed. An ULTRASOUND MACHINE and MONITOR is on beside her.

dialogues.speaker: CLEO
dialogues.text: Di, we're sorry. We...

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: It's off... I can't take the fighting, the back-stabbing, the open hostility. We're not acting like cheerleaders, we're acting like a bunch of sorority girls! The squad rushes to a sobbing Diane, embarrassed by their behavior and what it's done to Diane.

dialogues.speaker: DIANE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (through tears) It's all my fault. I'm sorry I ever started this...

dialogues.speaker: KANSAS
dialogues.text: Di, it's not your fault. We all wanted to do this - for you... for ourselves. Squad AD-LIBS agreement. Cleo picks up the ULTRA-SOUND HA PIECE beside Diane and starts fiddling with it.

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: Look, maybe I can watch a PG movie... I'll just say I'm counting dirty words for Sunday School.

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: That's okay, Hannah. It was silly to think we could learn to rob a bank from watching movies. Sex - you can learn from movies. But robberies? There's no way. Cleo sets the HAND-PIECE on Diane's belly. The squad star in wide-eyed wonder at the monitor - for the first time t see Diane's baby. Diane doesn't notice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Besides, TV-LAND had a "Little House On The Prairie" marathon and the Ingalls made baby Carrie's bed in a dresser drawer. I guess I can just do that... Diane sees the squad staring and turns to the monitor.

dialogues.speaker: DIANE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh my G-d... She SEES HER BABY MOVING and GENTLY TOUCHES her belly wit both hands. It's all very real. Suddenly, the BABY SHIRTS FORWARD and we see a SECOND BABY'S HEAD.

dialogues.speaker: CLEO
dialogues.text: Ahh! Baby's got two heads!!!

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: It's twins!!

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: Oh, thank G-d! I'm not just super fat!

dialogues.speaker: KANSAS
dialogues.text: (building) Oh - okay, we ain't done with this... Those babies are gonna get a good start in life - with a real crib - one that costs a shit-load! We're gonna learn how to rob a bank from the only people who really know how to do it - criminals! I'm gonna visit my mom! Squad can't believe what she just said.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Hill, a tough looking woman who smokes like a chimne

dialogues.speaker: MRS. HILL
dialogues.text: You don't look nothing like your pictures. What happened to the curly red hair?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kansas.

dialogues.speaker: KANSAS
dialogues.text: Grandma and Grandpa sent you pictures of a neighbor girl. They didn't want you to break out and come kidnap me.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. HILL
dialogues.text: Thank G-d. I was starting to think I'd killed the wrong man. There's an awkward silence as the reality of this hits Kansas. Her mom lights up a cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: KANSAS
dialogues.text: You shouldn't smoke so many of those.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. HILL
dialogues.text: I know, but it keeps down the size of my can.

dialogues.speaker: KANSAS
dialogues.text: They could kill you.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. HILL
dialogues.text: So could half the women in here. And I'd rather go out with a nice can... So watcha here for? To say how much you hate me or how much your grandparents hate me...

dialogues.speaker: KANSAS
dialogues.text: I don't hate you. I need your help.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. HILL
dialogues.text: My what?

dialogues.speaker: KANSAS
dialogues.text: Your help.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. HILL
dialogues.text: Now how the hell can I help you?

dialogues.speaker: KANSAS
dialogues.text: (sitting close) Okay, you can't tell anybody.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. HILL
dialogues.text: Gee, I'll sit out this afternoon's coffee talk. Whaddya want?

dialogues.speaker: KANSAS
dialogues.text: My best friend got pregnant.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. HILL
dialogues.text: Before you? Whoo-hoo! They high-five through the glass.

dialogues.speaker: KANSAS
dialogues.text: I know - that's what I said too. Anyway, we want to help her get some money for the baby by robbing a bank.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. HILL
dialogues.text: Well, shit-fire, Kansas, that's the sweetest goddamn thing ever...

dialogues.speaker: KANSAS
dialogues.text: I know, but we can't quite figure out how to, y'know, do it.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. HILL
dialogues.text: (near tears) So you need my help? Oh my G-d, this is like asking me for help with your homework. (calling behind her) Hey, Mink, c'mere! MINK, a tough-looking woman with short spiky hair joins h

dialogues.speaker: MRS. HILL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Kansas, I want you to meet someone special.

dialogues.speaker: KANSAS
dialogues.text: Oh, Jesus Christ, Mom! Like my life ain't a great big pile-of-shit 'cause you're in here? Now I have to add, "P.S. My mom's a dyke" too?

dialogues.speaker: MRS. HILL
dialogues.text: What?! Hush up, you mouthy little shit!

dialogues.speaker: KANSAS
dialogues.text: Hey, don't "mouthy shit" me - I'm outta here.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. HILL
dialogues.text: Wait, Petunia. Mommy's a little amped up - didn't get her yard time this morning. Mink ain't my bitch. She's a specialist... in banks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rest of the squad, in uniform, waits in folding chair A LARGE INMATE stares at them, while slowly mopping the floor. All but Diane appear nervous. The inmate works her mop BETWEEN DIANE'S LEGS and stops.

dialogues.speaker: INMATE
dialogues.text: Thems some sweet skirts y'got there.

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: Well, thank you. They're actually uniforms - we're cheerleaders.

dialogues.speaker: INMATE
dialogues.text: Mmm-hmm... y'sure are. As she moves in closer, Kansas is let through a metal doo All jump up. Diane steps politely over the mop handle tha pressed between her legs.

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: Excuse us. The squad joins Kansas as they all hustle out the hallway

dialogues.speaker: KANSAS
dialogues.text: Same time tomorrow - we have a visit with our favorite "aunts."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAN DOWN the visitors' row. TOUGH MEN sit across from eve TOUGHER FEMALE INMATES. CONTINUE DOWN to the SQUAD, sweet and small in comparison - each sitting across from a DIFFERENT INMATE. Mrs. Hill walks behind the inmates, supervising.

dialogues.speaker: MINK
dialogues.text: Robbin' a bank is like pullin' a trick. You gotta stay in control, know how far you'll go for the dough and always put the rubber on yourself... Well, y'know what I mean. And you gotta do it the day after Christmas.

dialogues.speaker: KANSAS
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: MINK
dialogues.text: Banks never have a holiday pick up, so vaults are full. Besides, everyone's at home eatin' left-overs and beatin' their kids.

dialogues.speaker: INMATE
dialogues.text: .»..You're only seventeen? Shit, I was havin' my third by th'time I's your age.

dialogues.speaker: CLEO
dialogues.text: Really? You were cell mates with her? Oh my G-d, she was my hero! Did she tell you what Letterman's house was like?

dialogues.speaker: INMATE
dialogues.text: Y'gotta buy gats from "The Terminator." And tell him "Itchy" sent'ya.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: And "gats" are.

dialogues.speaker: INMATE
dialogues.text: Guns, cuties.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: And you're called "Itchy" because...

dialogues.speaker: INMATE
dialogues.text: You listen to Carol, pussycat, a foot on both sides-a-your bathtub nozzle - make your ride with the sisters seem like nothin' more-n-a piss shiver. Hannah frantically writes down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack is on his side of the bed, rubbing cream on Diane's  exposed belly as he sings to it. Diane is writing on her "From the Beautiful Mind..." NOT PAD, which rests above h big belly.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: (talking to Diane's belly) .»..so although their dad said, "Don't get out of the car until I get back with help," they knew the sheriff's voice as he yelled. "Run to my voice - and don't look back." The twins did as he said, but at the last second they turned around and saw the escaped mental patient, bouncing their father's head on the top of the car! (feels something) Ah! They jumped, Diane! They jumped!

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: That was gas, Sweetie.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Oh... What are you working on?

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: Jus some girlie things for the squad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Notepad. "From The Beautiful Mind of Diane" PAN DOWN to first item listed: 1) Buy ski masks and maternity underpants. As it's crossed off, we:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Diane watches as the squad MODELS BIG WHITE MATERNITY UNDERPANTS over their Addidas sweats, with pillows and stuffed animals in the belly portion. It's like some biza fashion show. A STERN OLD SALESWOMAN approaches. Diane points to Cleo's style, then hands the surprised saleswo FIVE SKI MASKS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE LIST as 2) Buy gats from "The Terminator" is crossed off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Squad stands FROZEN looking up at this cinder block shack bad, HAND-PAINTED SIGN on top has ARNOLD SCHWARZENEGGER STANDING ON A COCKROACH.

dialogues.speaker: KANSAS
dialogues.text: Whoever gets out alive -- have the authorities to check in the crawl space. Diane walks to the counter and rings the bell.

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: Kansas, you should never judge a book by its cover. HANK WOOD ENTERS (greasy hair, dirty coveralls, big rubbe gloves). He's a chain-smoker and reeks of insecticide. Th squad reacts. Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: (sotto) I guess there's an exception to every rule.

dialogues.speaker: KANSAS
dialogues.text: You're the "Terminator?"

dialogues.speaker: HANK
dialogues.text: You come in here to bust my balls? I kill bugs for a livin'. G-d already beat ya to it. He turns to exit.

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: NO! Wait...um... (nervous, but smiling) We're the A-squad from Lincoln High? So, uh...

dialogues.speaker: KANSAS
dialogues.text: We were told you could "fix us up."

dialogues.speaker: HANK
dialogues.text: (eyeing suspiciously) Really...

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: Yeah. "Itchy" sent us.

dialogues.speaker: HANK
dialogues.text: She did, did she? How is the old girl?

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: Definitely old.

dialogues.speaker: HANK
dialogues.text: (warming) That's Itchy, alright. How many y'need?

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: Well, we'll each probably want one - so let's make it five. Five should do it.

dialogues.speaker: HANK
dialogues.text: Okay. How much ammo you reckon you'll need?

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: Ammo?

dialogues.speaker: HANK
dialogues.text: Bullets.

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: Bullets? No bullets! Oh my gosh, these are just to scare people. Kinda like round-off, back handspring, whip back, double full. You never really use it - you just want the opposing squad to know you've got it.

dialogues.speaker: HANK
dialogues.text: Right. (beat) That'll be fifteen hundred - cash.  Squad REACTS!

dialogues.speaker: CLEO
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: KANSAS
dialogues.text: You piece-a-shit bug zapper!

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: Hey, hey, hey. C'mon you guys. (to Hank) Obviously that's a little more than our budget will allow. Basically, we're looking for something around two-hundred dollars.

dialogues.speaker: HANK
dialogues.text: Oh, why didn't you say. For two-hundred I got a nice rubber band and a real sharp nail in back... I'll gift wrap it for you. The deal is fifteen hundred. Cash. Take it or leave it.

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: What kind of deal would you make if I said we were going to the police and tell them you're selling illegal guns... to minors! To girl minors!

dialogues.speaker: HANK
dialogues.text: (big toothless grin) I'd just hafta kiiiiiill you.

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: Well, okay then. It was a pleasure meeting you. Take care, let's go you guys. Squad quickly exits. They stop,

dialogues.speaker: HANK
dialogues.text: Hold on! still facing the door.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: Oh please, we've all got bright futures ahead of us - we're not going to tell anyone. Promise!

dialogues.speaker: HANK
dialogues.text: Maybe we can make a deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, we're not gonna trade sex for guns. Unless Cleo... Cleo hits her.

dialogues.speaker: HANK
dialogues.text: My daughter's always dreamed of bein' a cheerleader. Put her on your squad and I'll give you the guns.

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: You're kidding.

dialogues.speaker: HANK
dialogues.text: Fern! C'mere! (to squad) She's siphoning tanks - takes a sec to cap off the cyanide hose. FERN, all of 85 pounds wet, ENTERS wearing BIG GOGGLES, B RUBBER GLOVES, BOOTS and a BREATHER which she removes and gasps for air.

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: We'll be right back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The squad runs out and gets into Hannah's STATION WAGON.

dialogues.speaker: KANSAS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Holy shit! That's a poster child for "Planned Parenthood."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slide of VAGINA.

dialogues.speaker: INSTRUCTOR, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: The vagina, forming the lower portion of the birth canal, will normally expand its folded walls to allow for the birth process... Suddenly Diane and the squad walk across the screen.

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: Sorry, we had our first basketball game -  went into overtime... Excuse us. Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: PULL BACK TO REVEAL
dialogues.text: Pregnant WOMEN on the floor, resting on pillows - husband kneeling beside them. CONTINUE TO PULL BACK with the squa as they make their way to the back row.

dialogues.speaker: INSTRUCTOR
dialogues.text: (annoyed) May I continue, ladies?

dialogues.speaker: KANSAS
dialogues.text: Sure. Unless it's hard for you to talk with that stick up your ass. A few couples LAUGH. Pissed, the instructor continues in B.G. Room starts LAMAZE BREATHING. Diane joins in.

dialogues.speaker: CLEO
dialogues.text: Is Jack upset that he can't be here?

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: (La Maze breathing) Hee-hee-haaaa-weee worked it out. Heee hee-haaa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack, kneeling on the floor. Behind him a MONITOR plays a Maze instruction video.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: (La Maze breathing) Hee-hee-heee-haaaaa, hee-hee-hee-haaaa, doin' good, Sweetie... (looking down) Hey-hey, let's remember our focal point! Jack raises a STUFFED ANIMAL by his face. PULL BACK TO REVEAL one of the social retards, CHRIS, playing the role Diane - head on a pillow beside Jack, La Maze breathing.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: (labor pain)

dialogues.speaker: AHHHHH
dialogues.text: CUSTOMERS, including Lisa, stop and stare.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: C'mon, don't stop now. We're gonna make it, baby.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: What a sad waste of a man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Squad reaches an open space at the back of the room. Dian gets down on her pillow - squad surrounds her. ROOM START LA MAZE BREATHING EXERCISES. Lucy takes out a piece of pa which she sets on Diane's belly for all to see.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: (whispering, pointing) Okay, even with all our savings, it's still only six hundred fifty-four.

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: (mid-breathing exercise) Hee-hee-hee, haaaaa-that's it? Hee-hee hee...

dialogues.speaker: KANSAS
dialogues.text: Don't make me Jerry Lewis you guys for the rest.

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: Hey, I even took my parents' foster kid money. Phillipe's gonna have to gather rice without pants this month.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: Look, you guys, three strikes we're out. Let's face it. It's time to abort! A COUPLE looks over - aghast. Kansas glares back.

dialogues.speaker: KANSAS
dialogues.text: Hey. Eyes on your own belly!

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: Hee-hee-h-wait a minute. Hold on, now. What do we do before a big game?

dialogues.speaker: CLEO
dialogues.text: Use the bathroom, because the Port-a Potties on the field are gross.

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: My fault - What do we do that enables us to be as great as we are?

dialogues.speaker: CLEO
dialogues.text: I personally think of how Conan started as a writer, then became a...

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: (jumping in) -- We practice! Sorry, Cleo.

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: That's right. Practice makes perfect. I'm practicing to have a baby right now. If we do a practice job, we'll not only get the experience, but also the extra money we need for guns! Squad quietly AD-LIBS their agreement.

dialogues.speaker: DIANE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I've got the perfect job - and I've gotta pee - help me up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
