dialogues.text: A SMILING OLDER WOMAN with a "Volunteer" button sits at a table with a "LUNCH TICKETS: $1.50" SIGN on it. LISA JANU approaches and hands her some money. The Older Woman star to SLOWLY COUNT OFF TICKETS from a roll. Impatient, Lisa grabs the roll, rips off some tickets, to the roll on the table and STORMS OFF. The Older Woman UNLOCKS THE METAL BOX (key around her neck), PUTS THE MON IN, then SHUTS IT. Diane ENTERS FRAME and gives her money. The older woman counts off tickets, smiles and gives them to Diane who be down to tie her shoe. The Older Woman UNLOCKS the metal box to put the money in KANSAS ENTERS, FALLS TO THE GROUND and fakes CHOKING. Cle runs up to Kansas - begging for help. The Older Woman hurries around the table to help as Hanna ENTERS FRAME, takes the open metal box and dumps the con into Lucy's Winnie the Pooh BACKPACK as she walks quickly THROUGH FRAME. Hannah hands the box to Diane who shuts it and puts it back on the table. BOTH EXIT in opposite directions as Kansas STOPS CHOKING, gets up and exits, followed by Cleo, who first helps the Older Woman to her feet and then exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The squad sits around the opened Winnie the Pooh backpack look of shock on their faces. After a long beat...

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: What the hell kind of food are they serving us that they can turn a profit on two hundred bucks!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Front door OPENS. Squad EXITS with a LARGE BLACK TRUNK an FERN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Squad looks miserable - Fern SMILES from ear to ear. The squad slowly STARTS TO SNIFF, then turn toward Fern.

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: Uh, Fern?

dialogues.speaker: FERN
dialogues.text: (monotone) Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: No more filling tanks before practice, okay?

dialogues.speaker: FERN
dialogues.text: "Kay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We watch the wagon DRIVE through Lincoln.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, y'know, what are you, anorexic or bulimic?

dialogues.speaker: FERN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Just skinny.

dialogues.speaker: CLEO, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Don't make me hate you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The station wagon pulls into the cracked driveway. The sq jumps out and runs around to the back of the car, pulling the large black trunk.

dialogues.speaker: KANSAS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: You guys wanna hurry up? My grandparents get back from dinner at four-thirty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Squad hurries down the open, unfinished stairs, lugging t trunk behind. It looks like a STUDIO APARTMENT - a unique combination of her grandparents' old '60's furniture and school memorabilia.

dialogues.speaker: CLEO
dialogues.text: I can't believe your grandparents never come down here.

dialogues.speaker: KANSAS
dialogues.text: You have three heart attacks and a half dozen strokes and tell me how much you wanna run up and down the stairs. Shit - I forgot to pick up the cigarettes. Squad forms a circle around the trunk.

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: Ready? She flips OPEN the latches.

dialogues.speaker: DIANE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (with squad) Okay! All help LIFT THE LID. Stunned SILENCE.

dialogues.speaker: KANSAS
dialogues.text: What the hell? WE SEE the trunk is filled with OLD GUN PIECES. Stocks, barrels, flint locks, rusty triggers, etc. Nothing seems go together. ALL TALK AT ONCE.

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: Oh no...

dialogues.speaker: KANSAS
dialogues.text: He Ikea'd us.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: Okay. How many signs do we need? We're not supposed to do this...

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: Maybe Lucy's right. Maybe this is a sign.

dialogues.speaker: KANSAS
dialogues.text: Screw Lucy!

dialogues.speaker: GRANDMOTHER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Kansas? FOOTSTEPS SOUND at the top of the stairwell. Squad quickl shuts the trunk and sits on it.

dialogues.speaker: GRANDMOTHER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Is that you down there?

dialogues.speaker: KANSAS
dialogues.text: Shit! (calling up) Yeah, Grandma. Me and the squad.

dialogues.speaker: GRANDMOTHER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Are you girls talking about boys? Practicing kissing your hands?

dialogues.speaker: KANSAS
dialogues.text: Oh yeah, you caught us... TWO OLD LEGS with SUP-HOSE and ORTHOPEDIC SHOES STEP DOWN the top step. Squad panics. Tries to quietly hide the trunk.

dialogues.speaker: GRANDMOTHER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Oh well, then I'll put some cookies at the top of the stairs for you gals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks! That'd be great. Old legs START BACK UPSTAIRS. Girls relax. Legs STOP, TUR and head BACK DOWN. Squad springs into action again.

dialogues.speaker: GRANDMOTHER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: You got that big retarded girl down there?

dialogues.speaker: KANSAS
dialogues.text: Uh...Yeah, Grandma. (to Hannah) She doesn't mean that. Kinda lost the old filter with her last stroke.

dialogues.speaker: GRANDMOTHER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Then I'll throw a few more treats on the plate. Where's my smokes?

dialogues.speaker: KANSAS
dialogues.text: I'll get them before "Touched by an Angel," don't worry.

dialogues.speaker: GRANDMOTHER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: You damn well better... LEGS DISAPPEAR. Squad relaxes.

dialogues.speaker: CLEO
dialogues.text: (loud whisper) This is great. What do we do? Threaten people with a trunk full of parts?

dialogues.speaker: FERN
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, you guys. But when you're dealin' with South American Rebels, you kinda gotta take what you can get. Squad AD-LIBS their frustration.

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: Excuse me, but do you guys know what I don't see here? Squad AD-LIBS "No. Uh-uh. What?" etc...

dialogues.speaker: DIANE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I don't see a problem. I see a great big craft project sitting right in front of us. So, Kansas, get me some glue, tape and a nail file... The squad looks at each other as Diane rolls up her slee and reaches into the trunk.

dialogues.speaker: DIANE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh, and some Lysol if you have...

Cleo opens her OVERNIGHT BAG and pulls out FIVE MODIFIED DOLLS - she CUT OUT their SCHOOL PICTURES and taped them the dolls' faces. ALL PLACE THEIR DOLL IN STARTING POSITIONS. dialogues.text: (muffled through head) Please join our "A" and "B" squad cheerleaders in a salute to winter sports! PULL BACK to REVEAL WE'RE:

dialogues.text: It's DECORATED for CHRISTMAS. Fightin' Log Mascot now wea a Santa Hat and red scarf. A JAZZ BAND on stage beside him starts up. With a voice l JIM NEIGHBORS, Bruce TIPS the Mascot Head BACK and launch into the following to the tune of "Rudolph The Red-Nosed  Reindeer."

dialogues.text: (singing slow intro) "I....see...girls swimming..." A HUMILIATED B-squad MEMBER - in swimsuit - ENTERS a SIDE DOOR and pretends to SWIM to CENTER COURT.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: "Boys swimming..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another B-squad MEMBER - dressed as a guy in a swimsuit - "swims" to CENTER COURT.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: "Ooooh, they look chilllyyyyy..." Squad members pantomime this to the JEERS FROM THE CROWD.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: "Volleyball for her..." B-squad MEMBER - in volleyball uniform - ENTERS and spike ball. It gets away from her and she has to CHASE IT. Crow CHEERS AGAIN.

dialogues.text: SIDE DOOR SLIDES OPEN. One by one, the squad, dressed as PREGNANT BETTYS - MASKS ON, MATCHING JACKETS and each hol a BOX FOR LONG STEM ROSES - jump out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as the MOTION SLOWS and, like a shot out of "Tombstone," LINE OF PREGNANT BETTYS disappear around the corner - coa blowing in the wind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BACK DOOR ENTRANCE. Cleo grabs the door handle - and it COMES OFF.

dialogues.speaker: KANSAS
dialogues.text: (panting) Who are you - the goddamn Bionic Woman?!

dialogues.speaker: CLEO
dialogues.text: I just pulled and it - it came off.

dialogues.speaker: KANSAS
dialogues.text: This is great - GREAT! Now we have to enter the front door!

dialogues.speaker: CLEO
dialogues.text: (taking off her mask to breath) Look, it's really not my fault. Kansas jumps at her, pulling her mask back down.

dialogues.speaker: KANSAS
dialogues.text: Hey! Rule number one - never take off the mask! Y'hear me! No matter what happens, NEVER TAKE OFF THE MASK!

dialogues.speaker: CLEO
dialogues.text: Sorry, Kansas...

dialogues.speaker: KANSAS
dialogues.text: (out of her mind) NO-GAH-BUH- NO! Rule number two - NO NAMES! NO GODDAMN NAMES, you retard!

dialogues.speaker: CLEO
dialogues.text: Oh for Chrissakes... (with emphasis) "White trash Betty." (back to normal) I didn't realize the rules went into effect before we entered Safeway.

dialogues.speaker: KANSAS
dialogues.text: (pushing her for emphasis) Well, use your head, "Stalker Betty."

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: Bettys, stop it! "The best squad is one that hopes for the best and prepares for the worst." National High School Cheerleading Association letterhead. Now, let's give a hands in... All form a circle, putting their right hands in.

dialogues.speaker: DIANE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We're ready. We're prepared. And this is going to be the best bank robbery ever, because...

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: (loud whisper) Cheer-leaders kick... All swing arms overhead and SMACK THE "ASS" of the girl t their right.

dialogues.speaker: MUSIC UP
dialogues.text: They start back around the corner. Suddenly someone dress as a PREGNANT NIXON turns the CORNER - all SCREAM!

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: (it's LUCY) SHH! It's me.

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: Lucy?

dialogues.speaker: KANSAS
dialogues.text: What the hell do you want?

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: I want to help. I'm part of this squad...

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: (nerves build to rage) Oh no! You committed the ultimate sin - you left our squad to be with a guy. And - and that guy is the Devil himself - "cause only the Devil would turn you against your sisters! All stare at her... then start to LAUGH.

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: (arm around Hannah) Hannah, you really have to stop taking that church stuff so literally.

dialogues.speaker: LINE
dialogues.text: Walking in SLOW MOTION, this time with the PREGNANT NIXON the end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as they STOP at the MAIN ENTRANCE.

dialogues.speaker: IN UNISON
dialogues.text: the squad TUCKS their BOXES tight under their right arms, then takes a step FORWARD - AUTOMATIC DOORS OPEN and they ENTER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUZAK PLAYS. Squad steps off the black electronic met, th stops. CUSTOMERS FALL SILENT. It's a sight to behold. Onl MUZAK CONTINUES. Kansas holds up a hand and counts off ONE, TWO, THREE FINGERS. All pull the RED RIBBON off their rose box with hand - smoothly grabbing the guns they've glued and taped together with the other - as they move into their next position (Kansas and Hannah take point as Diane, Cleo, Lu and Fern move into the bank branch). Cleo fumbles with he box, dropping her gun. The barrel falls off, CLANKING as rolls away from her. Nixon helps her stick it back togeth

dialogues.speaker: SAFEWAY CASHIER
dialogues.text: Uh, y-y-y-you robbin' the Safeway, or the bank?

dialogues.speaker: SAFEWAY CASHIER
dialogues.text: S-s-so y'want everyone down? O-or just the people at the b-b-bank branch? They never thought about that...

dialogues.speaker: KANSAS
dialogues.text: All of you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (same time) Bank branch! People start to get down who were up, others get up who w down. Kansas and Hannah look at each other a beat, then:

dialogues.speaker: KANSAS
dialogues.text: Bank branch!

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: (same time) All of you! People start to MURMUR and, once again, reverse their positions. Kansas and Hannah move together for a brief conference.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy and Cleo stand under it, shoulder to shoulder, inner hands joined, looking up. Fern RUNS IN FRAME and JUMPS on her HANDS. They POP her up to their SHOULDERS making a STANDING PYRAMID. Fern pulls out SPRAY PAINT and sprays o the SECURITY CAMERA LENS.

dialogues.speaker: ON KANSAS AND HANNAH
dialogues.text: conference ends. They return to point positions.

dialogues.speaker: KANSAS
dialogues.text: Bank branch only! Everyone else - go on about your business! EVERYONE near the bank starts to get down. Unable to "go about their business" with a robbery in progress, Safeway CUSTOMERS just stare. After an uncomfortable beat.

dialogues.speaker: KANSAS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Shit - EVERYBODY DOWN!

dialogues.speaker: MUSIC UP
dialogues.text: Everyone goes ass-up. Kansas and Hannah nod with their success, then shoulder their guns.

dialogues.text: as she slowly gets on the floor - watching Lucy, Cleo and Fern spray painting the security camera.

dialogues.text: as this stunt registers across her face - it's an illegal dismount! She starts to count Bettys...

dialogues.speaker: ON DIANE
dialogues.text: in the bank branch, moving like a shark - never stopping knowing exactly where everything is.

dialogues.speaker: FACTORY WORKER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No-sireee-bob...

dialogues.speaker: ON KANSAS AND HANNAH

dialogues.speaker: KANSAS
dialogues.text: Freeze or meet Jesus, Ass-hole! Kansas shoulders her gun. The barrel starts to droop, the glue isn't holding. She quickly reaches out to straighten it.

dialogues.text: he stops, dead in his track.

dialogues.text: Don't we never take the Lord's son's name in vain around this part of the U-S

dialogues.speaker: FACTORY WORKER, (CONT'D)

dialogues.text: they're freaking out.

dialogues.speaker: ON CUSTOMERS

dialogues.text: (ranting) ...I'm walking evidence! One of them stopped my ass! (turning ass to camera) Can you get a shot of it!? (calling to tech) Hey, can someone dust my ass for prints over here?! The male reporter waves TWO PARAMEDICS OVER - signaling "crazy" and pointing to Lisa.

They're all in their undies (find why in a second) - money stuffed everywhere. Diane goes b to hanging freshly washed bills (from the barf bag) to dr

dialogues.text: Can you guys believe this? We're like celebrities!

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: Better enjoy it now. 'Cause tomorrow some little kid falls down a well and we're nothing but a distant memory. Kansas enters from a back room.

dialogues.speaker: KANSAS
dialogues.text: Disguises incinerated! Squad CHEERS and throws money at her.

dialogues.speaker: KANSAS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Bad news, Di, there's one thing we just couldn't fit in the furnace...

dialogues.speaker: FERN
dialogues.text: pushing a DOUBLE CRIB. It's filled with baby items, stuff animals, etc.

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: Oh my G-d! A real crib! You guys - thank you! Can you believe we did it!? (reality hits) I mean, we did it. We REALLY DID IT! Squad CHEERS and starts to throw money around again.

dialogues.speaker: LISA, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: I guess no one could've predicted the shit-storm that was about to hit. The only thing people cared about, thought about or talked about was the robbery. Everyone had a theory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Safeway Cashier talks into an "Action News '98" mic.

dialogues.speaker: SAFEWAY CASHIER
dialogues.text: ...well, judging by the way the robbers practically flew up to spray paint security cameras, I think it was an Asian gang. As a people, they tend to be quite tiny and very acrobatic...

dialogues.speaker: LISA, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: That's all it took, then the next thing you know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: S.W.A.T. MEMBERS surround this Americanized Chinese restaurant - machine guns at the ready. SUDDENLY, a small frightened Asian man walks out, hands in the air.

dialogues.speaker: LISA, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: ...Dim-Sum Charlie's being hauled in for questioning...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BANK BRANCH WORKER talks into a "Channel 5" mic.

dialogues.speaker: BANK BRANCH WORKER
dialogues.text: I think it was five pregnant women, mmm hmmm. My wife and I have two babies of our own and there's no accounting for the things they'll do when they're in that "condition." One night my wife came home from work and she just kicked me in the balls. To this day, I don't know what came over her - just kicked me in the balls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A POLICE OFFICER stands beside a POLICE SKETCH of a PREGN BETTY.

dialogues.speaker: LISA, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: From there, the town just seemed to go  ape-shit... PREGNANT WOMEN YELL and point at ANOTHER PREGNANT WOMAN they've cornered. UNFORTUNATELY she looks just like a WEN DOLL. Her husband tries unsuccessfully to prevent TWO OFFICERS taking her away. The squad sits quietly - horrified by th witch hunt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Factory Worker talks into an "ABC" mic.

dialogues.speaker: LISA, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: News of this didn't stop at the border of Lincoln County. This thing spread faster than a canker sore on the girls' swim team. Someone in Lincoln would say something like...

dialogues.speaker: FACTORY WORKER
dialogues.text: It was a bunch of faggots! Sure-as (BEEP). They was dressed like a bunch of freakin' Wendy Dolls, for chrissakes. They had faggoty little voices. (removing charred cap) And only a buncha G-d-(BEEP) queer'd shoot up a union cap!

dialogues.speaker: LISA, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: All of a sudden...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JERRY SPRINGER talks INTO CAMERA from the audience.

dialogues.speaker: LISA, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: It's on Jerry-fuckin'-Springer!

dialogues.speaker: JERRY SPRINGER
dialogues.text: ...today, we'll meet a growing number of transvestites who don't just like to dress up as women, they like to dress as pregnant women. When we return, "Transvestites with a Twist."

dialogues.speaker: ON STAGE
dialogues.text: TWO TOUGH-LOOKING MEN, dressed as pregnant women, stare at the audience.

dialogues.speaker: LISA, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: (alternate line) I'm not talking "Maury" or "Leeza." This thing was definitely huge!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A POLICE CAR with TWO OFFICERS cruises a neighborhood str They pass DONUTS back and forth to each other. Through th windscreen, we see TWO SMALL CHILDREN WEARING WENDY MASKS playing "cops and robbers."

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN QUIVERS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: In other news...oh, did you hear about the six-armed Betty Dolls that robbed a bank the other day?

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD STERN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Oh man, that's so my fantasy - life size Bettys tellin' me what to do. "Get down on the ground, you filthy man." Yes, Giant Betty. "Bend over!" Yes, Mistress Betty.

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN QUIVERS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: They were pregnant.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD STERN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: What?! Knocked-up Bettys?! Couldn't-a been Ken, his schlong is molded to his body. Hey, at the police line-up, they should just see whose knees can bend the wrong way...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOB GOEN sits at the anchor desk.

dialogues.speaker: BOB GOEN
dialogues.text: ...when we come back, a behind the scenes look at Fox's week long series "When Bettys Attack."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAN PATRICK sits behind the desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tonight in St. Louis, bottom of the ninth...

dialogues.speaker: DAN PATRICK, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Ramirez with the pitch... McGwire gone... FOLLOW BALL...

dialogues.speaker: DAN PATRICK, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: McGwire goes yard for the forty-second time this season...

dialogues.speaker: STANDS
dialogues.text: FANS, dressed as PREGNANT BETTYS (masks, jackets, etc.), reach up for the ball. One catches it, holds it up and wa to the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: DAN PATRICK, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: ..vight into a waiting pack of pregnant Bettys.

dialogues.speaker: DAN PATRICK
dialogues.text: Did I say that right? A "pack" of Bettys? It might be a "gaggle" of Bettys...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A COSTUME PARTY is in full "swing." Guys (not in costume) one side, girls (in costume) on the other.

dialogues.speaker: KENNY
dialogues.text: (mumbled, pointing 0O.C.) What the hell?! The GROUP OF GUYS TURN to see CARTMAN, dressed as a PREGN BETTY - machine gun in hand, approaching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell are you s'posed to be?

dialogues.speaker: CARTMAN
dialogues.text: I'm a bank-robbin' Betty.

dialogues.speaker: STAN
dialogues.text: You're not a bank-robbin' Betty - you're a fat fuck in drag...

dialogues.speaker: CARTMAN
dialogues.text: I am not a fat fuck in drag!!! Cartman opens fire, KILLING KENNY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan and Andy sit at a desk. Conan talks to camera.

dialogues.speaker: LISA, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: Then it happened - the moment I'd been waiting for! Our dip-shits in blue finally followed up on my evidence...

dialogues.speaker: CONAN
dialogues.text: ...they now believe a group of young women are responsible for the Betty Bank Robbery. (to Andy) I've said for years the Betty Doll was a bad influence on young girls.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: You sure have...can't shut you up about your Bettys.

dialogues.speaker: CONAN
dialogues.text: (laughing) That's right. Now, I mean I'm no authority on young girls. (mugging to camera) Or am I? (to Andy, laughing) That was kinda creepy.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Do you have to notify police if you move?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: with

dialogues.speaker: ON LEFT
dialogues.text: Diane on phone with:

dialogues.speaker: ON RIGHT
dialogues.text: Kansas on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: KANSAS
dialogues.text: It was Lucy! Lucy went to the cops!

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: Remember, Kansas, every time you point a finger you've got three more pointing back at you.

dialogues.speaker: KANSAS
dialogues.text: She's been the weak tit on this mama cat since the beginning.

dialogues.speaker: KANSAS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That you?

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: Yeah, hold on.

dialogues.speaker: KANSAS
dialogues.text: Just call me later. I gotta get some smokes for Grandma.

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: Don't use big bills!

dialogues.speaker: KANSAS
dialogues.text: For a pack of cigs? I use her food stamps. Diane presses her receiver and SLIDES SCREEN RIGHT (PUSHI KANSAS OFF) as Hannah, on the phone, FILLS IN ON THE LEFT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: with

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: (freaking out) We're dead! They showed this prison movie to my youth group on Sunday.

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: Hannah, we've...

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: It wasn't like the prison we saw - all these women had to shave their heads because they got lice from the filthy lives they'd lived! Oh G-d, I'm gonna be someone's bald bitch!

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: Ooops, hold on a sec. Hannah continues to rant as Diane PRESSES her receiver an SLIDES SCREEN LEFT (PUSHING the ranting Hannah OFF) as Lu on phone, SLIDES ON, SCREEN RIGHT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: with

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: Di, it's Luce. Kansas just called and said she's going to "fuck me up!" Then I heard coughing, a thud and Kansas had to go. I think her Grandma had another heart attack. Anyway, why does she want to "fuck me up?"

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: She thinks you went to the police.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHAT?! That's insane!!! Why would I go to the police?

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: I've got to get that. Relax. I'll see you tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: with

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An exasperated Diane presses her receiver again and SLIDE SCREEN RIGHT, PUSHING LUCY OUT as Hannah - STILL RANTING COMES BACK IN SCREEN LEFT.

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: .».my Sunday School teacher says that in prison, women shove broom sticks up your...

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: Hold on... Diane presses her receiver again and SLIDES SCREEN LEFT, PUSHING HANNAH OUT, DIM SUM CHARLIE, on prison phone - SL ON, SCREEN RIGHT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: with

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: DIM SUM CHARLIE
dialogues.text: (screaming in Chinese) Oh thank Buddha it's you, Kim-Lo, I'm being held against my will, my civil rights have been violated and it took four days to make this one phone call...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: DIM SUM CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Kim-Lo?

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: No. This is Diane. I think you have the wrong number.

dialogues.speaker: DIANE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ooops, that's me -- gotta run!

dialogues.speaker: DIM SUM CHARLIE
dialogues.text: (about to kill himself) Wrong number Nooooooo! Diane presses her receiver again and SLIDES SCREEN RIGHT, PUSHING DIM SUM CHARLIE OFF, as Cleo, on phone, SLIDES ON SCREEN LEFT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: with

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: CLEO
dialogues.text: Di? I just called to say that Conan talked about us again last night.

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: (first smile in a while) Thanks, Cleo. See you tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: CLEO
dialogues.text: Bye. Diane and Cleo hang up. SPLIT SCREEN DROPS DOWN. Hannah, still ranting, DROPS IN - FULL FRAME.

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: ..and a "bitch slap." I bet that  really hurts!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Foggy mirror. A HAND WIPES IT CLEAR, revealing Diane (SAM AS OPENING) .

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: (still perky) Morning, sunshine. Remember, except for the morning sickness, blinding back pain and embarrassingly unpredictable gas - these are the best days of your life. She starts to EXIT, then RETURNS.

dialogues.speaker: DIANE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So far. She BUCKS HER CHIN, attempts a smile and starts to EXIT.

dialogues.speaker: DIANE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hey, hey, hey, not so fast... Diane returns to the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: DIANE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Following your dream is not a crime. Nobody suspects you. Nobody has a clue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOTION SLOWS as squad, in uniform, walks toward camera in line across the hall. Their CONFIDENT FACES quickly turn worry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STUDENTS, quickly moving out of their way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Squad (still in uniform) sit self-consciously at a table, one around them. WIDEN TO REVEAL students are crushed at opposite side of the lunchroom. Lisa and the B-squad approach.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: Hey guys. Someone not take a shower today? The B-squad smiles and chuckles at this.

dialogues.speaker: KANSAS
dialogues.text: Hey Lisa, did you run into Carmen Electra last summer?

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: No

dialogues.speaker: KANSAS
dialogues.text: Oh. 'Cause is looks like you got some of her tits in you... A-squad can't help but laugh. Lisa angrily hands Diane a letter.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: This just came from the National High School Cheerleading Association. You might want to look it over before you try any more "cradle dismounts from double base partner stunts that are over shoulder stand level without using three catchers." Oh, or before you think about robbing another bank. SQUAD FREEZE with these WORDS. Suddenly, the lunchroom is FLOODED with S.W.A.T. MEMBERS. It's PANDEMONIUM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're back with Lisa and the FBI AGENT. Lisa has drawn moustaches, beards, blacked-out teeth, etc. on the A-squa MUG SHOTS.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: ...and that's why I came forward. I mean, even the kids on the short bus can see that all the evidence points to Diane and the A-squad.

dialogues.speaker: FBI AGENT
dialogues.text: Sure does. Your testimony will prove invaluable.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: Unfortunately, it wasn't them.

dialogues.speaker: THE LIST
dialogues.text: "Get Alibi" is CROSSED OFF.

dialogues.speaker: LISA, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: They were all waiting in my Suburban while I ran into the Safeway that day for cash...

dialogues.speaker: MUSIC UP
dialogues.text: Lisa, now the A-squad Captain, is leading a cheer.

dialogues.speaker: LISA, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: We were on our way to practice. Now, I really need to get going, 'cause nobody ever got ahead by sitting on their behind... She's competent, not great. Squad, including Fern, is thrilled to be cheering. Diane, very pregnant, SMILES and WAVES from the stands.

dialogues.speaker: PHOTO
dialogues.text: a smiling Hannah. SUPER: HANNAH USED HER MONEY TO START A SMALL BUSINESS. PULL BACK to REVEAL she's sitting on a HORSE beside a si

dialogues.speaker: SUPER
dialogues.text: PULL BACK to REVEAL Fern is wearing camouflage and posing with a large semi-automatic on the cover of "SOLDIER OF FORTUNE" magazine. HEADLINE READS: "High-paid Women Assassins - Can They Hav All?" SUPER: AND USED HER MONEY TO TRAVEL THE WORLD.

dialogues.speaker: PHOTO
dialogues.text: A JUDGE who appears to be reading a verdict. PULL BACK to REVEAL Kansas and MRS. HILL anxiously awaiting his verdic

dialogues.speaker: PHOTO
dialogues.text: Lucy, in graduation cap and gown, waves from an auditoriu stage at HARVARD.

dialogues.speaker: PHOTO
dialogues.text: Pizza deliver box.

dialogues.speaker: PHOTO
dialogues.text: of a LUSH TROPICAL ISLAND.  SUPER: SHE NOW OWNS THE ISLAND OF GUANA, B.V.I.

dialogues.speaker: PHOTO
dialogues.text: Cleo's smiling face. SUPER: CLEO USED HER MONEY TO MOVE TO HOLLYWOOD.

dialogues.speaker: PHOTO
dialogues.text: PULL BACK to REVEAL she's wearing a ripped dress - "new" boobs bursting out. SUPER: WHERE SHE MET THE PRODUCER OF SCREAM VIII...

dialogues.speaker: PHOTO
dialogues.text: PULL BACK to REVEAL it's a MOVIE POSTER for SCREAM VIII KILLERS are behind her, holding knives and wearing BETTY MASKS.

dialogues.speaker: PHOTO
dialogues.text: CONTINUE PULLING BACK to REVEAL she's on "THE LATE SHOW W CONAN O'BRIEN." Conan O'Brien is holding the poster betwe them. She's laughing at something he's saying.

dialogues.speaker: PHOTO
dialogues.text: a smiling Jack and Diane - looking more mature and more i love.

dialogues.speaker: PHOTO
dialogues.text: PULL BACK to REVEAL they're surrounded by FOUR BEAUTIFUL CHILDREN - TWINS are five, others are THREE and TWO. Dian holds the youngest.

dialogues.speaker: PHOTO
dialogues.text: CONTINUE TO PULL BACK to REVEAL the VIDEO RETARDS (now in suits) on either side of Jack and Diane. SUPER: THEY WON.

dialogues.speaker: PHOTO
dialogues.text: PAN UP to REVEAL LARGE BANNER: "Congratulations Senator Bartlett" hanging above them.

dialogues.speaker: PHOTO
dialogues.text: Diane, smiling from ear to ear.

dialogues.speaker: CHEERLEADERS." .. .
dialogues.text: PULL BACK to REVEAL she's on an auditorium stage, handing LARGE CHECK to a very PREGNANT CHEERLEADER. SUPER: SO NO CHEERLEADER WOULD EVER HAVE TO ROB A BANK. AGAIN.

dialogues.speaker: PHOTO
dialogues.text: Lisa smiling in a wedding gown. SUPER: AND LISA...

dialogues.speaker: PHOTO
dialogues.text: WIDEN to REVEAL BRUCE IS HER GROOM. SUPER: SHE WAS WRONG ABOUT BRUCE. FADE TO BLACK. The End
